question: A rectangle with length 10 and width 7 has an area of 70. True or False?
A square with side 9 has a perimeter of 36. True or False?
A triangle with base 12 and height 6 has an area of 72. True or False?
A hexagon with side 5 has a perimeter of 30. True or False?
A circle with radius 7 has a circumference of approximately 44. True or False?
A parallelogram with base 8 and height 5 has an area of 40. True or False?
A right-angled triangle with sides 3, 4, 5 satisfies the Pythagorean theorem. True or False?
A rhombus with diagonals 6 and 8 has an area of 24. True or False?
A trapezoid with bases 10 and 6 and height 4 has an area of 32. True or False?
A circle is a polygon. True or False?
A hexagon has 6 corners and 6 sides. True or False?
A pentagon has more sides than a hexagon. True or False?
A square has equal sides but angles can vary. True or False?
A triangle with angles 50, 60, and 70 degrees is valid. True or False?
A parallelogram has opposite sides equal and opposite angles equal. True or False?
A rectangle with length 12 and width 5 has a perimeter of 34. True or False?
A triangle with sides 5, 5, 10 is a valid triangle. True or False?
A rhombus is a type of parallelogram. True or False?
A trapezoid has exactly 4 sides and one pair of parallel sides. True or False?
A circle has infinite straight sides. True or False?
A regular hexagon has all sides equal. True or False?
A square has a diagonal equal to the side length. True or False?
A triangle with sides 7, 24, 25 is a right-angled triangle. True or False?
A rectangle can also be a square. True or False?
The sum of angles in a pentagon is 540 degrees. True or False?
A hexagon has a sum of interior angles equal to 720 degrees. True or False?
A trapezoid with bases 8 and 6 and height 5 has an area of 35. True or False?
An equilateral triangle has all angles equal to 60 degrees. True or False?
A square and a rhombus are both parallelograms. True or False?
